issue.title: Fix: IME bug when typing Chinese characters

repository.name: egui
repository.description: egui: an easy-to-use immediate mode GUI in Rust that runs on both web and native

issue.body:
* Closes #4209 

Fix: IME bug when typing Chinese characters

body:
@Chaojimengnan 

I think it was resolved with #4210.

> @Chaojimengnan
> 
> I think it was resolved with #4210.

Thanks for the quick fix, but bug still exist.

@Chaojimengnan 

You may need to compile it after running cargo update as follows.

```
cargo update
```

> @Chaojimengnan
> 
> You may need to compile it after running cargo update as follows.
> 
> ```
> cargo update
> ```

yes, but bug still exist. 
it works correctly when I remove the following line
https://github.com/rustbasic/egui/blob/b689576c7d9ec16a334275a41dbc06198ac195fe/crates/egui/src/widgets/text_edit/builder.rs#L957-L958

@Chaojimengnan 

Please check if this fix works.
Maybe you can do it like this.
Please let me know the results.

```rust
                    if !prediction.is_empty()
                        && cursor_range.secondary.ccursor.index
                            == state.ime_cursor_range.secondary.ccursor.index
                    {
```


* #4210

> @Chaojimengnan
> 
> Please check if this fix works. Maybe you can do it like this. Please let me know the results.
> 
> ```rust
>                     if !prediction.is_empty()
>                         && cursor_range.secondary.ccursor.index
>                             == state.ime_cursor_range.secondary.ccursor.index
>                     {
> ```
> 
> * [Fix: IME bug when typing Chinese charactersÂ #4210](https://github.com/emilk/egui/pull/4210)

Thank you. It's working correctly now.
